title: Standard 5.4
text:
Qualified Administrative/Academic Officers


The institution employs and regularly evaluates administrative and academic officers with appropriate experience and qualifications to lead the institution.



☒ Compliant ☐ Non-Compliant ☐ Not Applicable




This is my narrative.











Name/Title


Responsibilities


Academic Preparation


Professional Experience







Dr. Person One


President



Provides leadership and overall management of HCC and its associated entities under the policies, rules, and regulations of the Board of Trustees, the State Board of Community Colleges, the State of North Carolina, and the Federal Government.



Ed.D. (2023), NC State


M.S. (2012), UNC


B.S. (2010), UNCW



President, January 2023 – Present; VP Student Affairs, UNC 2012 – 2022.





Person Two


Executive Vice President of Student Affairs



Provides leadership in a collaborative, supportive environment for all instructional programs/services, faculty, staff, and students. Serves as a member of the Executive Team and, in that capacity, provides support to assigned committees of the Board of Trustees.



Ph.D. (2020), NC State


M.S. (2016), UNC


B.S. (2004),


Duke



Executive Vice President of Student Affairs, August 2020 – Present; Dean of General Education July 2016 ­ July 2020.





Person. Three


Vice President of Business Services CFO



Responsible for the leadership and management of all functions associated with the Business Office, Serves as a member of the Executive Team and ex officio member of the Foundation Board of Directors.


B.S.B.A. (2006), NC State


Vice President of Business Services, July 2006 – Present.





Dr. Person Four


Director of Institutional Research



Responsible for the data.



Ed.D. (2010), NC State


M.A. Ed. (2003), UNC


B.S. (2002), UNC



Director of Institutional Research, September 2003 – Present.







The Director of Instructional Design & Online Learning serves as the distance and correspondence education coordinator for the College. See roster above for qualifications.






The College employs and regularly evaluates administrative and academic officers with appropriate experience and qualifications to lead the institution. Therefore, the College is in compliance with this standard.




All sources will be automatically listed here. Do not modify this section.

title: Standard 5.4
text: All sources will be automatically listed here. Do not modify this section.

title: Welcome
text:
Welcome
HCC's SACSCOC 5th-Year Interim Report is due September 8, 2024.
Welcome to Haywood Community College, where we believe education changes everything. We have many diverse programs to provide each student the opportunity to work toward a degree; enhance academic and job skills; enter the workforce; or enjoy a course of interest. Our goal is to provide accessible, affordable, and high-quality education, workforce training, and lifelong learning. We are here to provide each student with the information they need to make decisions that will enable them to achieve their goals and realize their dreams.




 Back to top
